meta.title: From SAHARA to DESERT
meta.author: Sandy Weisz and Mao Reynolds
meta.message: The Sahara Desert, spanning much of North Africa, is the largest hot desert in the world. The Sahara actually consists of 70% gravel or other rock, and even includes an active volcano: located in Chad’s Tibesti Mountains, Emi Koussi has been active for more than one million years. (This week's Raddles each use one of the 6 terrains from Settlers of Catan: hill, forest, field, mountain, pasture, or desert.)
